text: I don’t shout a vow. Emotion won’t save her right now—I need a gap. A slit wide enough for her to drive the necklace through.
I snatch up the hardest shard of stone from the snow and scoop a fistful of jagged ice into my palm. The splinters cut my skin. The pain clears my head.
The Demon King’s black mist spirals before the core, looping like chains waiting to snap around her wrist.
I don’t look at its face. I fix my eyes on the thinnest edge of the mist—like watching for the blink of an eye.
I draw in a breath, press my voice low—then let it explode.
“Hey—! Over here!”
I hurl the stone. It cuts through wind and snow, striking the edge of the mist—not solid flesh, but its shape.
The mist flinches, contracting for a split second like pricked skin. That contraction exposes the edge of the core’s fracture—like a door cracking open to light.
The Demon King’s focus shifts—not because I’ve ‘drawn’ it, but because it must react. The mist moves to repair the punctured thin point.
And repairing means something else must loosen.
Alicia’s eyes change. Not surprise—calculation. A hunter recognizing an opening.
Her fingers had been trembling—exhaustion pressing down like an old wound reopening.
But when the mist loosens by a thread, her grip steadies.
She tears open the clasp inside her cloak and pulls the necklace free. The pendant burns in the black light, but she holds it without hesitation.
The Demon King senses termination. The mist lashes back like a tide snapping at prey.
I have no second stone. Only one choice remains: make it believe the threat is still me.
I shout at it, voice tearing my throat raw, forcing my heartbeat into the darkness.
“Come on! Aren’t you dragging everything back? Look at me!”
The mist shifts again—just slightly. It doesn’t need to understand my words. It only needs to divide its focus—if only for half a second.
Half a second is the distance between life and death.
Her voice is hoarse, but she’s smiling. “…Good.”
She seizes the loosened seam and drives the necklace into the core’s fracture. The instant it sinks in, light ignites from within, bursting outward.
The Demon King howls, distorted and tearing. Its bone armor splits, fractures racing up into the sky.
Behind her, the core collapses inward—like the world drawing a breath.
The shockwave detonates outward. Snow and shattered stone surge like a white tide. Even the city walls tremble. Alicia is hurled toward me.
In midair, she twists—turning her back to the blast, shielding me from the worst of the storm.
